name: DNX.Tasks.BuildNugetPackage
friendlyName: DNX Tasks Build Nuget Package RC1
description: Build a Nuget package with dnx.
author: Kirsten Kluge

inputs.name: ProjectName
inputs.label: Project Name
inputs.helpMarkdown:
Name of the Projects to build.
You can provide a list by seperating the entrys with SPACE.
Make sure to wrap entrys with spaces in double quotes.
Eg: "My Sample.Web" Sample.Api

inputs.name: BuildConfiguration
inputs.label: Build Configuration
inputs.helpMarkdown: The build configuration to use. Default is "Release

inputs.name: OutputFolder
inputs.label: Output Folder
inputs.helpMarkdown: Where to put the pack output.

inputs.name: PreRelease
inputs.label: Pre Release
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, the nuget package will build as prerelease with VERSIONNUMBER-pre-BUILDNUMBER

inputs.name: WorkingFolder
inputs.label: Working Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory when script is run.

inputs.name: SourceFolder
inputs.label: Source Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Folder where your project directories are.
Default is: \src

inputs.name: SpecificRuntime
inputs.label: Specific Runtime
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, the runtime will be same as in global.json including architecture

inputs.name: UnstableRuntime
inputs.label: Unstable Runtime
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, the runtime will be from the unstable dev feed. This will give you the latest development version of the runtime.
